skill.name: pdf
skill.description: Comprehensive PDF manipulation toolkit for extracting text and tables, creating new PDFs, merging/splitting documents, and handling forms. When Claude needs to fill in a PDF form or programmatically process, generate, or analyze PDF documents at scale.
skill.summary: Comprehensive PDF manipulation toolkit for extracting text and tables, creating new PDFs, merging/sp...
skill.author: Anthropic

security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill with no security concerns. Uses standard PDF libraries (pypdf, pdfplumber, reportlab) for legitimate document processing tasks. All scripts perform safe PDF operations without network access or system modifications.

content.value_statement: Process, create, and manipulate PDF documents programmaticallyâ€”extract text and tables, merge and split files, fill out forms automatically, and generate new PDFs from scratch.
actual_capabilities: Extract text and tables from PDFs with layout preservation
Merge multiple PDFs into a single document
Split PDFs into individual pages or ranges
Fill out PDF forms (both fillable fields and annotation-based)
Create new PDFs from scratch with text, images, and tables
Rotate, crop, and manipulate PDF pages
Extract metadata and form field information
OCR support for scanned documents (with pytesseract)
Validate and repair form field bounding boxes
Convert PDFs to images for visual analysis
limitations: OCR functionality requires additional setup (pytesseract, pdf2image)
Complex form layouts may require manual bounding box adjustment
Some PDF viewers may display form annotations differently
Encrypted PDFs require password for processing
Large PDFs may require memory optimization techniques
Font embedding in generated PDFs limited to standard fonts without additional setup

use_cases.title: Automated Form Filling
use_cases.description: Automatically fill out PDF tax forms, applications, or surveys by analyzing form fields and inserting data programmatically. Handles both fillable form fields and annotation-based text entry.
use_cases.target_user: Business automation teams, administrative staff, developers building document workflows

use_cases.title: Data Extraction from Reports
use_cases.description: Extract structured data from PDF reports, invoices, or financial statements. Parse tables into DataFrames for analysis, export to Excel, or integrate with databases.
use_cases.target_user: Data analysts, accountants, researchers processing large volumes of PDF documents

use_cases.title: Document Assembly
use_cases.description: Merge multiple PDF documents (contracts, appendices, exhibits) into a single cohesive file. Split large documents into manageable sections or extract specific page ranges.
use_cases.target_user: Legal professionals, document management teams, publishing workflows

use_cases.title: PDF Report Generation
use_cases.description: Create professional PDF reports from scratch with text, tables, charts, and formatting. Generate invoices, certificates, or data reports programmatically.
use_cases.target_user: Developers building reporting systems, automated invoicing, certificate generation

use_cases.title: Content Analysis at Scale
use_cases.description: Process hundreds of PDF documents to extract text, analyze content, or convert scanned documents to searchable text using OCR.
use_cases.target_user: Researchers, compliance teams, content managers handling document archives

best_practices: Always read forms.md thoroughly before attempting to fill PDF formsâ€”it contains critical step-by-step instructions
For form filling, visually validate bounding boxes using validation images before generating the final PDF
Use pdfplumber for text/table extraction instead of pypdf for better layout preservation
Process large PDFs in chunks to manage memory usage effectively
Test filled forms in multiple PDF viewers (Chrome, Firefox, Acrobat) as rendering may vary
Use qpdf command-line tool for fast merge/split operations on large document sets
For scanned PDFs, check if OCR is needed before attempting text extraction
When creating PDFs with reportlab, use Platypus for complex layouts instead of low-level Canvas
anti_patterns: Don't skip the validation image step when filling forms with annotationsâ€”overlapping bounding boxes will produce incorrect results
Don't use pypdf's extract_text() for structured dataâ€”use pdfplumber for tables and layout-aware extraction
Don't load entire large PDFs into memoryâ€”use streaming or page-by-page processing
Don't assume all PDF viewers render form fields identicallyâ€”always test filled forms
Don't guess form field IDsâ€”always use extract_form_field_info.py to get accurate field information
Don't skip the bounding box intersection check (check_bounding_boxes.py)â€”it prevents overlapping text annotations

faq.question: How do I fill out a PDF form?
faq.answer: Read forms.md completely first. The process differs based on whether the PDF has fillable fields. Run check_fillable_fields.py to determine the type. For fillable forms, extract field info, create a field_values.json, and use fill_fillable_fields.py. For non-fillable forms, convert to images, analyze visually, create bounding boxes in fields.json, validate them, then use fill_pdf_form_with_annotations.py.

faq.question: Can this extract tables from PDFs?
faq.answer: Yes, use pdfplumber's extract_tables() method. It handles most table layouts well and can export to pandas DataFrames. For complex tables, adjust extraction settings like vertical_strategy and snap_tolerance. The reference.md file contains advanced examples.

faq.question: How do I handle scanned PDFs?
faq.answer: Scanned PDFs are images and require OCR. Install pytesseract and pdf2image, convert the PDF to images with convert_from_path(), then use pytesseract.image_to_string() on each image. See the 'Extract Text from Scanned PDFs' section in SKILL.md.

faq.question: What's the difference between pypdf and pdfplumber?
faq.answer: pypdf is for basic operations (merge, split, rotate, metadata). pdfplumber excels at text and table extraction with layout awareness. Use pypdf for document manipulation, pdfplumber for content extraction.

faq.question: Can I password-protect generated PDFs?
faq.answer: Yes, use pypdf's writer.encrypt() method with user and owner passwords. See the 'Password Protection' example in SKILL.md. To remove passwords, use qpdf with --decrypt flag.

faq.question: Why do my form annotations look wrong in some PDF viewers?
faq.answer: PDF viewers render annotations differently. Preview.app on macOS has known issues with form fields. Always test in multiple viewers (Chrome, Firefox, Adobe Acrobat). Font size and color may not work consistently across all viewers due to PDF specification limitations.
